verses.text: 1 "JESUS_END"The song of songs, which is Solomon's.
2 "JESUS_END"Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth: for thy love is better than wine.
3 "JESUS_END"Because of the savour of thy good ointments thy name is as ointment poured forth, therefore do the virgins love thee.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-1-4/" title="Song of Solomon 1:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4  "JESUS_END"Draw me, we will run after thee: the king hath brought me into his chambers: we will be glad and rejoice in thee, we will remember thy love more than wine: the upright love thee.
5 "JESUS_END"I am black, but comely, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, as the tents of Kedar, as the curtains of Solomon.

6 "JESUS_END"Look not upon me, because I am black, because the sun hath looked upon me: my mother's children were angry with me; they made me the keeper of the vineyards; but mine own vineyard have I not kept.
7 "JESUS_END"Tell me, O thou whom my soul loveth, where thou feedest, where thou makest thy flock to rest at noon: for why should I be as one that turneth aside by the flocks of thy companions?

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-1-8/" title="Song of Solomon 1:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8  "JESUS_END"If thou know not, O thou fairest among women, go thy way forth by the footsteps of the flock, and feed thy kids beside the shepherds' tents.

<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-1-9/" title="Song of Solomon 1:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9  "JESUS_END"I have compared thee, O my love, to a company of horses in Pharaoh's chariots.
10 "JESUS_END"Thy cheeks are comely with rows of jewels, thy neck with chains of gold.
<a href="../Song-of-Solomon-1-11/" title="Song of Solomon 1:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11  "JESUS_END"We will make thee borders of gold with studs of silver.
12 "JESUS_END"While the king sitteth at his table, my spikenard sendeth forth the smell thereof.
13 "JESUS_END"A bundle of myrrh is my wellbeloved unto me; he shall lie all night betwixt my breasts.
14 "JESUS_END"My beloved is unto me as a cluster of camphire in the vineyards of Engedi.
15 "JESUS_END"Behold, thou art fair, my love; behold, thou art fair; thou hast doves' eyes.
16 "JESUS_END"Behold, thou art fair, my beloved, yea, pleasant: also our bed is green.
17 "JESUS_END"The beams of our house are cedar, and our rafters of fir.
